Notes: Both use registry-based env management. mjlab uses manager-based system instead of decorator pattern
mjlab uses Python dataclasses instead of Gin. More Pythonic but requires code refactoring
Both integrate with RSL-RL for PPO training
mjlab uses MuJoCo Warp (GPU-accelerated) instead of MJX. Different compilation backend
mjlab uses PyTorch instead of JAX. No automatic JIT compilation
Both use RSL-RL PPO with configurable hyperparameters
Both support configurable hidden layers and activations
mjlab doesn't support RNN/LSTM in policy networks
mjlab doesn't have mirror loss or symmetric trajectory generation
mjlab has observation normalization but different implementation
Both support max_grad_norm parameter
mjlab has velocity and tracking tasks. Missing specialized envs (crawl, climb, stair, box, chair, etc)
mjlab supports more robots out of box
Both have pluggable reward systems with dynamic registration
Both support time-based reward weight adjustment
mjlab missing DeepMimic-specific rewards (body_quat, site_pos tracking)
Both have linear and angular velocity tracking rewards
Both have torque-based power consumption penalties
Both penalize action rate changes
mjlab has posture reward with configurable std per joint
mjlab has exponential pose tracking but not configurable per reward type
mjlab has policy/critic observation groups
mjlab doesn't support temporal observation history/frame stacking
Both support asymmetric teacher-student information
Both observe joint positions and velocities
Both have torso angular velocity and orientation. mjlab has simpler noise model
Both embed commands in observations
MJX has cyclic phase encoding. mjlab only in tracking task
Both include previous action in observations
mjlab supports custom scaling per observation (like MJX)
Both support configurable action scaling
mjlab doesn't have built-in n_steps_delay parameter
mjlab has decimation parameter (n_frames in MJX)
mjlab supports scale/offset per actuator via dict
Both support friction, damping, armature randomization
Both support body mass variation
MJX has kp/kd/tau_max randomization. mjlab has basic actuator randomization
Both support varied starting conditions
Both support external force/velocity perturbations
Both have comprehensive noise models (uniform, gaussian)
MJX has AR(1) processes and bias random walks. mjlab has simpler additive bias model
Both support configurable terrain types
Both support step-based reward weight transitions
mjlab has command curriculum but different implementation
mjlab doesn't have enabled_motions progression
mjlab doesn't have two-phase training (exact tracking -> command following)
Both support velocity, angular velocity commands
Both support dynamic goal changes with resample_time
Both support per-dimension min/max bounds
mjlab has rel_standing_envs and heading commands
mjlab supports NPZ motion files (tracking task)
mjlab uses NPZ instead of LZ4. Need conversion
mjlab doesn't have ZMP-based walking reference generator
MJX has 4+ directions. mjlab tracking task supports motion files
mjlab tracking has frame handling but not as flexible
mjlab doesn't support end-effector site position tracking
Both support algorithmic terrain generation
Both support heightfield-based terrains
Both support difficulty-based terrain progression
Both support XML scene files
Both support configurable collision detection
Both support uniform noise for observations
Both support Gaussian noise
mjlab has NoiseModelWithAdditiveBias
mjlab doesn't have autoregressive noise models
mjlab doesn't have bias random walk (sensor drift)
Both support W&B logging
Both support model saving/loading
Both support distributed training
Both support play/evaluation modes
Both support visual progress tracking
Both log training statistics
Both handle contact forces
Both support PD control, force/velocity limits
Both support solver parameter tuning
Different backends but both GPU-accelerated
Both support parallel environment execution
Both use vectorized operations

Category: 2. Convert Gin configs to mjlab dataclass configs
4. Convert motion file formats (LZ4 to NPZ)
- mjlab uses PyTorch instead of JAX (different paradigm)
- Configuration system is fundamentally different (dataclass vs Gin)
- mjlab is more modular and cleaner but missing some specialized features
- Core training infrastructure is equivalent or better in mjlab
- Most RL fundamentals are present and well-implemented
